direction.raw_text: ON a spectacular example of PEUCETIA VIRIDANS. Descending through mid-air on a silken thread. Neon green with black leopard spots on its legs. A Green Lynx Spider. As we follow it down, the threaded opening of a GLASS JAR appears from the bottom of frame. Just before the spider continues inside the jar, it stops, suspended. Something's not right. It waves a leg tentatively through the air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... Just a little lower...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: N TO REVEAL a Middle School TOILET STALL. Standing on the lid of the closed toilet, holding the glass jar up over his head, is DARREN SHAN. Darren is 14 and a well-liked kid. Tenacious. Diligent. The spider just hangs there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... I'll take good care of you. All the bugs you can eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door bangs open and STEVE LEONARD enters. Unlike Darren, Steve's not so well-liked. In fact, he can be trouble. Maybe that's why they're friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Darren! No answer. Steve walks along the stall, scoots low so he can see any feet in front of the bowls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you fall in? Darren!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh... Steve looks to the last stall, sees the jar being held up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from in and outside of the stall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're gonna scare him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, we're getting killed out there. It's three to nothing. Darren is all concentration as the spider drops a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your problem, Steve, not mine... Steve gets a waggish idea. Stepping to the sink, pressing his forefinger over the spigot, he turns the faucet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out in a stream, which Steve directs into and then over the stall door. Reacting, the spider zips up its thread, is lost in the darkened ceiling. The stall door opens. Dripping water, Darren stares at Steve who flashes a wicked grin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kids eat lunch, off in their groups. On the field: Darren has a SOCCER BALL practically glued to his foot. He dribbles through defenders, shoots, SCORES! Steve pumps a fist:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Three to one! The other team regroups, starts back upfield with the ball. Darren steals it. A few strides and WHUMP! Darren catches the goalie too far out. The ball lofts just over the backpedaling goalie's head, bounces into the goal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three to two! Angry at himself, the goalie KICKS the ball away. It veers off toward the street. Steve takes it as a personal insult.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that prove? Huh? The goalie blanches as Steve moves at him. Kids are nervous about Steve. He likes to fight. Darren gets between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go get the ball. It's 3 to 2. Lunch's almost over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why he kicked it. To kill time. Well, I still got time to kick your face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. The ball. Steve decides, heads after it. The goalie gulps in relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Darren. He's crazy. Darren watches after Steve. He does have a vicious streak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve tracks down the ball which has rolled into the street. From seemingly out of nowhere... A gleaming black 1966 LINCOLN Continental. Its tires sucking at the asphalt as it rolls. The windows blacked out. It speeds up reaching the ball. Ba-Dump! The ball BURSTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You idiot! The car SCREECHES to a stop, idles ominously. Suddenly Steve doesn't seem so tough. He looks nervously back to Darren. But as a WIND picks up, the Lincoln suddenly tears off. A sheet of PAPER is kicked up by one of the car tires. The wind sends it sailing. It drifts down, until... Steve notices, snatches it out of the air. Darren steps up beside him, watches the Lincoln disappear down the street. Creepy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at this. The paper is a FLYER. A startling, violent layout. Beneath a snarling WOLF'S HEAD: CIROUE DU FREAK - Human oddities and other living curiosities. Midnight. Zeiterion Theater. $20 - Admission is at the discretion of the proprietor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Human oddities and other living curiosities... (TO DARREN) Other. Does that mean not human?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren shrugs, takes the flyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A freak show. Ever been to one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just this school. Darren turns the flyer over. There are tire tracks on the back. They hear the sound of distant tire squeals, but the Lincoln is long out of view. Just an empty street now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probing the confines of its glass prison. A BOA CONSTRICTOR by any other name. It's a prison within a prison because we're inside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The teacher, MR. DALTON, moves ponderously around the room. His voice like a metronome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DALTON As you can see reptiles and amphibians are not one in the same. As Mr. Dalton continues, we see various PAIRS OF STUDENTS, their computer screens showing text or pictures of various
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and LIZARDS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and STEVE sit together staring at a Komodo Dragon. After Mr. Dalton passes by, Steve switches screen views. He's done a WebSearch of Cirque du Freak. There are a dozen or so entries. He picks one: History of the Side Show. Under 1920's there's an older, much more 'Victorian' pamphlet for the Cirque du Freak. A more ornate version of the same Wolf Head. The same notice from the proprietor. Steve spreads the flyer out to compare. They whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be a different one. Steve scrolls down through pictures:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sword swallower and glass eater: OHIO GRAY. Frog boy: AVERY CHILDS. Human skeleton: J.D. COMBS. .and then... Egyptian Soothsayer: LARTEN CREPSLEY. Crepsley's gaze is startling. Like he can see through the screen, even from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve looks like he's just seen a ghost. Suddenly, he hits print. As a PRINTER against the wall clicks to life, Steve looks back at Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta show you something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picture perfect: two stories, dormers, trellises. 9-year-old
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides up on her bike, bookbag over her shoulder. Without stopping, she hops off, dumps it on the lawn by two other bikes. A few steps and she's through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moody for the daytime. Only the light from the half-closed blinds streaking the floor where: Darren and Steve are huddled over several clippings and pictures that Steve has spread out. They all deal with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in some form or another. Steve pulls another stack from his backpack, spreads them out as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vampires. I've been studying them. Vampires? Darren looks at him a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. You're failing half your classes at school, but you're studying vampires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They been around 1000's of years. Two tribes. They even fight wars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, sometimes, when humans fight? They fight at the same time. And no one knows it. Like at the Battle of Stalingrad they fought at the same time the Russians and Germans were fighting. Darren just looks at him, wonders if he's serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people know about it. There have even been books written. He pulls a frayed old yellow hardcover from his bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your proof? It smells. Steve's really trying to convince him now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's everywhere if you look. On the internet, in blogs, newspapers, weird places. But you can find it. The room starts to tighten a notch around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I chatted online with one of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serious. We become aware of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone watching Darren and Steve through the half open doorway. It moves in, starts coming up from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was his name? Mr. Dracula? Mad now, Steve opens the book, flips pages, finds an old 19th Century painting. He slaps down the science lab internet print-out of Larten Crepsley. It's the same guy! Maybe...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here he is in 1923. And here 1855. Huh? Maybe he'll be there tonight. Would that make you believe? As Darren looks them over, the POV looms up behind them. Suddenly Darren spins... And ROARS at what's behind them: his sister Annie. She
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in response. Steve jumps a mile. Darren LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saw your shadow on the floor. Gotta try harder, knucklehead. Steve snaps his book shut, shoves it in his backpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna get a soda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me one, too. Steve gets up, stomps out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve opens the refrigerator, looks to see what's in there. At the same time Darren's MOTHER arrives home. Coming in through the kitchen door, she sees the refrigerator door open, two sneakered feet behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you want to fight global warming, Darren, but that's not the way to do it. Steve leans back to show his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Mrs. Shan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hi, Steve. I thought you were, Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I was. (RE: FRIDGE) You guys got everything in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help yourself. She sets her PURSE down on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's okay... She's been working a lot lately. A little frown of concern crosses Darren's mom. Something about Steve... His mom... He brings out a bottle of soda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glasses are up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Darren's mom exits as Steve pulls down two glasses, starts to pour soda. As he waits for the foam to settle, he sees... The purse. Just there. A quick look around, it doesn't take him long to decide. Steve steps over, opens the purse. A quick rifling finds a wallet: $200 in $20's. He peels off three bills, shoves them in his pocket. BLLEEEP! A cell phone starts going off in the purse. Fumbling, frantic, Steve stuffs the rest of the money back in the wallet, the wallet back in the purse, closes the purse -- Darren's Mom is back in. She's hurrying to get to her celiphone, so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? .it takes her a second to realize something's up. Not listening to her call, she watches Steve grab the two glasses and hurry out, leaving the soda bottle on the counter and guilt in the air. As she looks over at her purse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve comes up off the stairs. He sets the glasses on a hall table, continues into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's looking through Steve's vampire memorabilia. Steve reaches past, starts packing it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go. See ya tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Tonight where? He zips the bag, slings it over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cirque du Freak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got no money right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't sweat it. I got money. Meet me ten to Midnight. The Zeiterion Theater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That place is supposed to be haunted. Steve rolls his eyes, starts out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I going to tell my parents?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell them you're sleeping over. We can meet early, walk over together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, man...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's Cirque du Freak. You wanna hear about it Monday? Or see it tonight? Steve lets his point sink in, then goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Annie and his mom and DAD eat dinner. Annie chatters away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's why we need a dog. She waits for an answer. Mom and Dad exchange a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you guys decide who's going to say no when you look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever's eyes are the widest. And I didn't say no. Yet. As she tries to think through a new approach...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom? I'm gonna sleep over Steve's tonight? Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (emphatic; no hesitation) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I said so, Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fourteen. I shouldn't even have to ask stuff like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The answer is no. And I'm not sure I want you hanging around with Steve anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've known him since I was five years old!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People change and I don't like the way Steve's changing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But -- That's not fair!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop arguing with her, Darren. Furious at his treatment, Darren gets up, stomps out. As Annie wonders if she should ask what's up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The moonlight glinting off Darren's spider terrarium. Darren, under the covers, gets out of bed. Fully dressed. Going to his door, he listens. Then he crosses to the window. Pulling out the screen, he starts to climb out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren out his second floor bedroom window, starts to climb down via the trellis. CRACK! A section of the trellis
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: under his feet. Darren almost falls, catches hold. He pulls himself over, starts down again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part of a dilapidated, mostly abandoned downtown. Noirish. Darren and Steve hurry around a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here after your house. There was a van there, guy selling tickets. (holds up tickets) Rest is history. They cross toward the ornate, albeit crumbling facade of the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Deserted, except for a few CANDLES burning on the sidewalk by a door. The wind moans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know why they closed it, right? Years ago a kid fell out of the balcony and died. It's haunted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve catches himself getting spooked. He shoves Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paint peeling. The walls scribbled on. Most of all - it's dark. Darren and Steve head toward a glow coming from...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move toward a light at the end. Darren pauses at a darkened staircase. Headed up. He points it out to Steve...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The balcony. Where he fell...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I help you? They wheel around, react to the sight behind them. MR. TALL. Gaunt, but oozing an elegant toughness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here to see the show. He takes an ominous step forward, then holds out a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Ticket. Steve hands it over. Mr. Tall pockets it, looks to Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Do you have your ticket? Darren. Darren starts to hand it over, hesitates. The guy knew his name. Mr. Tall reaches, takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL This way. We're about to begin. Mr. Tall turns on his heel and strides off. As they follow:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knew my name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he heard me say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mr. Tall turns a corner, only steps ahead of them. But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When they turn it, Mr. Tall is gone. Vanished. Ahead, a threadbare velvet CURTAIN. A low murmur on the other side. The boys exchange a last look, then push through into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouldings removed, cherubs gouged from the walls of a once proud theater. Rows of seats are missing as well. Those that remain are filled. The crowd seems nervous, watching the empty stage expectantly. Yearning for something special. No sign of Mr. Tall. Darren and Steve stand at the top of the aisle. The only kids here. Somewhere off stage a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sounds and with it a stage light goes out. Steve nudges Darren, points out two empty seats halfway down. As they move for them, a second trumpet sounds and a second stage light goes out. And so on. By the time Darren and Steve take their seats, the theater has gone black. A final flourish from the trumpets and all is silent. Then, a dull green light glows across the stage. Before it was empty; now there is a CAGE, set on wheels, in the center. There's the scraping of chain. A low guttural sound. A white spot shines down, leaves the front half of the cage in light, the back half in shadow. A FIGURE moves in there.. The AUDIENCE lean forward, hoping to see when there's a ROAR! Several people SCREAM as the figure CRASHES to the front of the cage. A WOLFMAN for lack of a better term, its body covered in thick, matted hair. It roars again, shakes the bars. Its half-canine teeth yellow, its eyes red. A chain hangs attached to an iron collar around its neck. Half the audience believe it's real. The other half are amazed at how real this 'performer' seems. As they buzz, Mr. Tall steps out on stage. Wearing red leather gloves and hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Ladies and Gentlemen. Welcome to the Cirque du Freak. We are an ancient circus. We have toured for five hundred years...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren and Steve exchange a look at this information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL .Bringing the remarkable and grotesque to generations. Our freaks are not people in masks. They are not harmless misfits. What you see tonight is real. Each performer unique. None harmless. To prove this, the Wolfman lunges, reaches a claw through the bars to swipe just centimeters short of Mr. Tall who's non- reaction shows he knows exactly where he's standing. A ripple goes through the crowd as they become aware of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Startlingly beautiful. Dressed for the Moulin Rouge. Crossing the stage in a languid catwalk. Several MEN in the audience begin to cough and shift in their seats. Even the Wolfman takes notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Beauty and the beast. Truska approaches the cage, makes soothing motions, her upper body swaying. The Wolfman lulls to a trance. Two stage hands - MIDGETS apparently, hidden by blue robes, step out and start to push the cage off stage. Truska steps toward the audience, moving in the same languorous rhythm. And then: she begins to grow a BEARD. Hairs creeping from above her lip, curling from her chin. Some in the audience recoil. Darren and Steve trade grins. This is great. Then... From either wing of the stage come twin contortionists: SIVE & SERSA. They walk on their hands, their legs pulled back with their ankles cinched behind there necks. As Truska exits, Sive and Sersa meet in the middle. Like Hindu wrestlers they take turns, climbing up and down each other, look like one person with two fronts. They twist like pretzels, getting huge LAUGHS when they pretend to be stuck. As it goes on, RHAMUS TWOBELLIES pads out to watch. The floorboards creak under his feet. He must weigh 600 pounds. After a moment, he turns, walks toward the audience. The light leaves the contortionists and focuses on Rhamus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Rhamus Twobellies. And I do have two. He TRIPS, stumbles toward the edge of the stage. PEOPLE in the front row jump back to keep from being crushed. Rhamus stops short, LAUGHS at them. He was pretending. He's practically doubled-over, resting his hands on his haunches. More blue-robed MIDGETS roll out a CART covered with food and lots of other stuff. Rhamus grabs a GLASS BOTTLE of soda. Instead of opening it, he bites off the glass top, chews it and swallows. Soon he's eating food almost as fast as he can grab it. Disgusting, but great fun at the same time. Next, he holds up a couple of nuts and bolts. Then swallows them whole. He swings his belly around. You can hear the sound of metal shifting inside. The crowd recoils as he starts to regurgitate, spitting out
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a JACKKNIFE. They clatter on stage. Finally, a METAL LINK appears between his teeth. He pinches hold of it and pulls. A CHAIN starts out of his mouth, up from his belly. One foot...two...six feet in all. With a shrug he starts off stage, dragging it behind him. Darren & Steve break into applause. So does the audience. As Rhamus' chain slides out of sight, a SNAKE slides in. An enormous BOA CONSTRICTOR. Impossibly huge. It slithers out to the center of the stage, its tongue flicking in and out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flicks down from above. The snake stops, raises itself several feet off the ground as it looks up, seemingly transfixed by the light. But in reality... The end of a thick ROPE drops down. And moving (headfirst!) down the rope is a BOY. Very thin, his blonde hair tinged with green. This is EVRA VON. He moves smoothly, twists over backwards to set his feet down on the stage. Evra wears a sort of cloak which he suddenly spins out of. The audience GASPS... Wearing only shorts, Evra's body
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He's covered in gold, blue and green scales! He moves a vaguely webbed hand through the air, charming the snake which raises itself higher still. He slowly slides forward till he and the boa are nearly eye-to-eye. Then Evra leans forward and KISSES the snake on the nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's as old as us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evra starts to make a HISSING sound. In response, the snake begins corkscrewing around him like the stripes on a barber shop pole. Finally, it slithers around his neck, pulls back to look him in the eye. And then... Evra bends at the knees, lays down and starts to roll. Like he was wrapped in a snake carpet, he disappears stage left. More applause from the audience. Then the stage goes dark except for a small focused spot at the center. Everyone waits, but nothing happens until... Appearing literally out of nowhere - one instant there's nothing under the spot and the next instant there is -- LARTEN CREPSLEY! Motionless, looking past the crowd. The only difference from his pictures is he's a bit older and a SCAR runs down his left cheek. It stretches his mouth up on that side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recognize him. Can't believe their eyes. Steve pulls the print-out from his pocket, compares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley disappears! The crowd mumble nervously. And just as suddenly he's back! On the edge of the stage, lit by the footlights. This time he holds a draped BIRDCAGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not true. That all tarantulas are poisonous. Though some can kill a man. With one bite. Crepsley whisks off the covering. In the cage: a TARANTULA the size of a large man's hand. So big you can make out individual eyes. As deadly looking as it is beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reacts. A spider!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley makes the introduction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name? Madam Octa. Pray that she never learns yours. Two of the blue-robed 'little people' lead a GOAT onto the stage. A ripple of worry runs through the crowd. Crepsley starts over. The goat BLEATS. The little people hold it. Mr. Crepsley flicks open the cage door with his finger. The spider sets its front legs on the bars, pulls itself through. A few gasps from the audience. The goat bucks. Madam Octa bares her fangs, poised to leap on her prey. Several audience members CRY OUT that this should stop. Crepsley looks out with mock-theatrical surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...? Shall it be life? Chuckling to himself, he looks to the goat tenders. They release the goat which bee-lines its way off the stage. Crepsley faces the audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wonder if you would be as shocked to see the same fate for me? Madam Octa moves -- climbing the outside of the cage -- taking a cautious step onto the hand holding the cage, then starting up Crepsley's arm. He stands dead still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a million questions, but right now the performance has their full edge-of-their-seat attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madam Octa has nearly reached Crepsley's left shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Though we have been together such a long time, she is no pet. I think she would quite enjoy killing me. Crepsley calmly raises his free hand. It holds a shiny TIN WHISTLE. Madam Octa has reaches his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For her bite there is no cure. Madam Octa bares her fangs, even longer now. Her malevolence about to be directed at her master. Crepsley carefully puts the whistle to his mouth and starts to play, as simple as it is evocative. Madam Octa hesitates. Then, she moves around his throat, starts to climb his face using his scar as her guide. She gets to the top of his head, stands in his shock of hair. She sways; she's dancing! Then she leaps, lands on the end of the whistle. Crepsley keeps playing as Madam Octa attaches a web, drops down about
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: inches off the end. She starts to swing. Crepsley takes the whistle from his mouth and twirls it around. Octa does a few 360s and the thread breaks. She sails up high over Crepsley's head. He cranes back to watch as down she comes, legs splayed. She lands flat on his face. The whistle is in his hand. Crepsley looks out at the audience. Looking out between her hairy legs, his eyes are wide with horror. Without warning, the spotlight on him goes out. As the stage is plunged into darkness, we hear Crepsley SCREAM. A horrible, horrible sound. The audience wait, but nothing happens. Some of them rise from their seats, peer into the gloom. It's too dark. The sound of something being DRAGGED. Then nothing. A light comes up stage left as Mr. Tall steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Thank you, ladies and gentlemen. That is the end of our show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But... What happened to him?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Don't you know? What happens to us all, can happen to any of us. That said, there's a crack of thunder and an explosion seemingly at Mr. Tall's feet. He's nowhere to be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The houselights come up. The stage is empty. Some in the audience start to clap. Others are a bit dismayed. Darren and Steve sit there as people start for the exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get outta here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you go. I'm staying. Steve starts down toward the stage. Darren follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. What're you doing? Steve reaches the stage, looks around. The audience is mostly exited; no one from the Cirque is in sight. As Steve starts up onto the stage, Darren grabs his shoulder. Steve wheels, shoves Darren who stumbles back into a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my destiny. Don't ruin it. Steve looks dangerous as he looms. Darren raises his hands in surrender. Steve eases off, but he's still intense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That car today. It was a sign. Sending me here. I was told there'd be a sign. Too friggin' weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Told by who? The guy in the chat room? The internet guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you later. If I can. Steve scrambles onto the stage and disappears into the back. Darren stands, whispers into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve... Decision time. Darren climbs up, starts after his friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren moves back into the gloom. Deserted, the junk casts sinister shadows. Then, a sound at his feet. Darren stops short. Sees that he's almost walked into an open stage DOOR IN THE FLOOR. The sound is someone moving below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve...? No answer. Darren decides, starts down steep, rickety steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - UNDERSTAGE STORAGE AREA He moves past a dilapidated stage elevator. Stumbles. As he heads further into the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming down the creaky stairs. Spooky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning a corner, is startled by what turns out to be a costume mannequin. But beyond: a LONG BOX set on two sawhorses. Coffin-sized. Empty, its lid propped up by it. The dust is tracked with footsteps. A mini-FRIDGE hums in a corner. Steve steps over, sees an EXTENSION CORD which runs up the wall, disappears into a hole punched in the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stops short as a LIGHT suddenly cuts through the gloom to his left. Darren steps over low behind a CREDENZA. He sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's opened the door to the fridge. The little bulb inside pushes through the gloom, lighting the area up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reacts as MADAM OCTA tries to jump on his face! The bars of her CAGE stop her. It rests on the credenza he crouches behind. The whistle is there too. Darren looks over as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaches in the fridge, takes out a glass jar that looks to be filled with BLOOD. Steve raises it, swirls it around inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you looking for me? Steve whirls -- drops the bottle -- SMASH! Standing behind him - dead still - CREPSLEY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rooted to the spot. Watching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crespley sniffs the air - the spilled blood to be exact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know who you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, boy. Who am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too broad a definition. Do you introduce yourself as a human? Who I am is Larten Crepsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving slightly to get a clearer view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley suddenly DISAPPEARS, REAPPEARS much closer. Steve jumps, twists around. Unnerved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who sent you and what do they want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. No one. Crepsley takes a moment to decide if he believes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to join you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Join me? I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to make me a vampire. Not what Crepsley (or Darren) expected. Steve stands there trying to look resolved. Crepsley is surprised, intrigued.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it because you want to live forever? Because we don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about living forever. But you do seem to live a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long time alone. Do you want to live alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you an orphan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father's gone; my mother doesn't care about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nor mine. You're friendless also?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a friend, but he doesn't understand. He's got too much to know what it's like to be alone. As Darren reacts to this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you're alone you feel weak. Useless. But I know there must be something strong about it, too. I want to feel the power of being alone. I want to be a vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The power of being alone will never be greater than the weakness of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. Crepsley's actually impressed, but after a moment he waves a dismissive hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It makes no matter. We do not blood children. I'm sorry. Steve pulls a JACKKNIFE from his pocket, flips open the 2- inch blade. Crepsley laughs out loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you intend to use that on me? And we feel it more than see it, but Steve cuts into his own palm. He holds it up, moist and red in Crepsley's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it. Make me a vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not tempt me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't believe what he's watching. He sees Crepsley suddenly get 'scent' of something. Something to do with Steve's blood. Not quite a clear view as Crepsley grabs Steve's wrist, dabs a finger into his palm and then tastes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley shoves Steve down to the ground and immediately begins spitting onto the floor. Like it was poison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have bad blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can taste the menace in your blood. You can never be a vampire. You're evil. Steve scrambles to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a lie. You take that back! Crepsley draws himself full, his voice deadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go home. Suddenly cowed, Steve just stands there blinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Steve runs, disappears into the gloom. After a moment, we can hear him scurrying up the stairs. Then he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frozen to his spot, watches as Crepsley, seemingly ill, holds his head and spits again onto the floor. Then he steps over and kicks the fridge door closed. And in the blink of an eye, he's gone. Disappeared. Darren is alone. He starts out, then stops. Looks back. That beautiful spider. And Darren takes Madam Octa's cage and the whistle and makes a run for it. Just like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dead quiet. Darren hurries home, cage in hand. Looking over his shoulder. So far so good. He nearly trips over an untied shoelace. He sets down the cage, to tie it. Madam Octa lunges across her cage at a WORM on the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. You want that? Darren picks up the worm, lowers it between the bars. A beat and then Madam Octa snatches it away from him. Dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? I'm your friend... You're so beautiful I stopped thinking. The wind rustles. Darren grabs the cage, continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house dark. Holding the cage with one hand, Darren starts climbing the side of the house using the other. He avoids the broken section, but as he reaches the window: His Dad is standing there looking out. Busted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get inside. From his angle, Darren's Dad can't see the cage in his son's hand. Darren hooks it over the end piece of part of the trellis and climbs in. Leaving the cage hanging behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren stands across from his Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A freak show? Are you kidding me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was down at the old Zeiterion Theater. Look, dad, I'm sorry. It's just, I couldn't resist. I -- DAD You told me the other day you were broke. You were looking for a job to do around the house this weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you get money for the show?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve had money. Darren's Dad's suspicion is confirmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve... We weren't going to tell you, but we think Steve stole money from your Mom's purse yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom's pretty sure about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, what is this? You don't want me hanging around with him. Now you say you think he stole money? Do you know for sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve's had some bad times lately. I'm trying to be a good friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Being a good friend and sneaking out are two different things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to sneak out! You treat me like a kid! A moment as Darren's raised voice rings out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then act like an adult if that's how you want to be treated. This world is crossed by fences -- Darren interrupts. He's heard it a million times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I know. And you gotta decide which side you stand on. And you can't sit on it either. His Dad doesn't enjoy hearing his words thrown back at him. He starts for the door, looks back before exiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A freak show. What do they do, put people in cages for everyone to laugh at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren feels bad, like a kid. He looks down at the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't like that. A beat. Darren's Dad goes, closing the door. Darren sighs. He goes to the window, pulls up the cage. He scans a look outside. Except for his Dad, the coast is clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSET - DARREN'S BEDROOM - NIGHT Darren sets the cage on a shelf, shuts the door. Black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's Mom making omelettes. Darren's DAD helping, dicing up some ham. Annie sits at the table awaiting the results.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he in a lot of trouble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing a few years in prison won't take care of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see what the big deal is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you talk to Steve's mom yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get this. She said she couldn't comment because she didn't make it home last night herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where was she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go tell Darren it's breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - VIDEO VIEW Seen through the bars of her cage. FREEZE FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's just snapped her photo with his DIGITAL CAMERA. As the door bursts open and Annie enters... Darren scrambles to block the cage from view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie, you gotta learn to knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom said to come eat. What's that? As Annie tries to look, Darren stays in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out. Annie sighs, heads out. Darren puts the cage in the closet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren arrives, sits as everyone pretends not to notice. His mom slides his omelette off the pan into his plate. Annie watches everyone's every move. Darren eats a bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, this is the best omelette I ever had. His Dad can't help but smile. Good move. Mom is pleased, but knows she's being manipulated. As Annie stifles a laugh, Darren shoots her a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the kitchen door. Annie gets up, opens the door to reveal: Steve. From his angle he can only sees Annie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, midget, where's the idiot? Annie motions Steve in. He stops short when he see everyone else. He recovers, does his best Eddie Haskell...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Mr. Shan, Mrs. Shan. It's nice to see ya. As Steve gets several less than welcoming looks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Steve enter his bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? Everyone acting like they don't know me. Did I walk in on something? Darren closes the door. Gets to the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. I hung out in the theater for awhile, but no one was around. The lie hangs in the air a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about the way I acted. I'm sorry I pushed you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. There's, you know, no bad blood or anything like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said don't worry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said bad blood. I never heard you say something like that before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you, the word police? Steve gives him a look. A weird tension in the air. Darren glances at the bandage on Steve's palm, changes the topic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna see that new game I got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure... Darren steps over, starts his computer up. While waiting, Steve sees the digital camera on the dresser, picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta get one of these. Steve switches it on. Something occurs to Darren too late...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me see that -- On the screen: the PHOTO OF MADAM OCTA. Steve twists around to keep the camera out of Darren's reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Madam Octa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took it at the show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar. Look at the background. This got taken right on your desk. Darren's caught. As they just stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In her cage, on the desk. Darren and Steve looking her over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were loading a van outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just took her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like that... (after a look) You stole from a vampire you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just because he had a coffin doesn't mean he's really a... Darren trails off. Steve realizes Darren saw the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were there, weren't you? (NO ANSWER) You heard what he said to me? That I was evil?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't believe it. Steve studies Darren, hopes that's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard what you said to him, too. That you wanted to be a vampire. Steve doesn't want to talk about it. He looks at Madam Octa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you think he made her do what he wanted? Darren opens his desk drawer, pulls out the flute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I knew how to play it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that was just for show. I think he used something else. Some kind of mind control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean telepathy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet anyone with a brain could do it. Which leaves you out. Steve smiles, gives Darren a little punch in the arm. The tension is loosening. They react to a KNOCK on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I come in? Darren goes to the door. Opens it a few inches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God, Annie...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? I knocked. As they talk, Steve opens the cage door. Madam Octa sets her arms on the edge, pulls herself out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lands on Steve's shoulder. Her fangs, wet with poison, glint just before she sinks them into Steve's throat. She BITES!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve surges upward, his shout dying in his throat. He stiffens, eyes snapped wide, and then crumples to the floor. Darren and Annie react as -- Madam Octa scurries off, disappears behind the curtain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move. Annie freezes. Darren grabs a BASEBALL BAT which leans in the corner. He reaches out, pokes at the curtain with it. Madam Octa drops down onto the window sill -- WHAM! Wood cracks as Darren brings down the bat, but Madam Octa is too quick. She disappears, leaping out the open window! Darren pulls it shut. He rushes back to Steve, turns him over. Steve's skin is already a deathly pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve... Annie reaches out, takes Steve's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren, he's freezing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get dad. Go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hospital doors BANG OPEN as a gurney bearing Steve is rushed through. Darren and his Dad follow with a DOCTOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of spider was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think some kind of a tarantula.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It got away. Darren's Dad holds up the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a picture of it. The doctor takes it as a NURSE meets the gurney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anaphylactic shock. Get Doctor Lund. And we need to download a photo to poison control. This is as far as Darren goes. Steve is wheeled in, surrounded. Syringes are drawn, handed in. All we can see of Steve is one skinny arm hanging out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sick for Steve. Scared. Unaware that his world has only just started to crash down around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUND - HOSPITAL CORRIDOR Tough, no nonsense. Marching along, carrying a print-out, coming to a stop where Darren sits on a plastic chair. He sticks the print-out into his face. The PHOTO of Madam Octa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUND How did you make this and why would you make this? Darren's Mom and Dad start over from down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUND Poison control couldn't ID it. In fact, the department of Entomology at Harvard couldn't find it in their data base. So either it's a new species or it's a fake photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If my son said he took that photo, then that's the truth. Dr. Lund just stares at Darren. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you done to him?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches, her eyes on Darren. Disheveled, cheap looking, she hasn't quite started her hangover yet. She lunges past Darren's dad, grabs Darren by the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hurt Stevie?! Did you?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She shakes Darren hard. Darren's Dad gets between them. She breaks down, sobbing. Darren's mom tries to soothe her as she moans about what a bad mother she is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LUND Your friend's going to die unless we find out what's in him. On Darren. He looks down to where light spills out from Steve's room. His friend is going to die in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren as he lays in bed, staring at the ceiling. His clock switches to 2:58 AM. Deciding, Darren gets out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dressed, Darren climbs out the window, starts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead lonely as Darren approaches, steps up to the glass door. As he leans in to look into the lobby, the door gives a little. It's unlocked. Darren pushes it open with a finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's by the credenza where he hid. The coffin is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who comes up from below and crosses. Stay with him as he parts the curtains and comes out on the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where he stops short, sees in the center of the stage -- Crepsley's COFFIN. A beat and Darren steps up. He grips the lid, starts sliding it back. He looks inside to see -- 35. Madam Octa perched on the side, staring back at him! Darren stumbles back. The coffin lid SLAMS to the stage as Darren loses his footing, lands on his butt. And then -- APPLAUSE. One pair of hands create a hollow echo. Crepsley sits alone in the middle of the theater. Clapping. And then he's gone! Only to reappear over Darren, offering a hand up. Darren scrambles to his feet. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you come for this time? Darren pulls out a CRUCIFIX, holds it in Crepsley's face. The vampire takes it, looks it over. It has no effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crosses don't hurt you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because... you're evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I? Are vampire bats evil when they drink the blood of cows?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's different. Bats are animals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So am I. So are you. Our appetites don't make us evil. (as Darren ponders...) Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your spider bit my friend Steve. Crepsley shrugs, tosses Darren back his crucifix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, well, boys who play with things they do not understand can hardly complain if -- 36.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to help him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The antidote to her poison is rare. Expensive. Why should someone as evil as I am waste it on Steve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll pay you back. If it takes 50 years. Whatever it costs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money doesn't interest me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something you want. That's why you're here waiting for me. Right? Crepsley's surprised and pleased by Darren's intuitiveness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night Steve came below to speak to me, you were there. Did you hear what we talked about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanted to... become like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't just 'become' a vampire. The change is too extreme. And if the shock didn't kill you, your inexperience would. So you become one in stages. A half-vampire at first. With greater strength than a human, but still able to go out in sunlight. You learn from a full vampire. Do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But your friend has bad blood. He's no good. There's no telling what he'll become as he matures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe that someone can have bad blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And yesterday you didn't believe in vampires. Regardless, I've left the Cirque. Left my protection. I need someone to protect me while I sleep. I need an apprentice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? Crepsley nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy. There's no way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then your friend will die. The words hang in the air. Crepsley smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hardly have a choice. It's your destiny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Destiny? That doesn't make sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try this then. You're reckless enough to steal, responsible enough to come back for a friend. That's enough for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, well, destiny can't be explained. It must be lived. Now, you're wasting my time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's gotta be another way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please... He's my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he slips away while we argue. Life or death? Yes or no?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd never be able to trust me. If I got a chance for payback I'd take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes or no? Thoughts rush, then stop. Darren finally just nods. Crepsley raises his right hand. The nails are not especially long, but they look thick and sharp. Crepsley takes Darren's hand, jabs at his forefinger, draws blood. He dabs off a drop, smells it, then tastes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have good blood. Crepsley lifts his own left hand. He presses the nails of his right into the fleshy tips of his left hand fingers. Then he uses the left nails to mark the right fingers in the same way. Blood drips down all ten fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lift your hands. Darren does as he's told. Crepsley digs all ten nails into all ten of Darren's fingertips. Darren jerks back in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get used to pain. More lies ahead. He motions to his hands. Darren raises them, fingers spread. Crepsley presses his fingertips to Darren's. Blood brothers. As their eyes lock, Darren frowns at an alien sensation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blood flows into your left arm and out of your right. Do you feel it? Getting near your heart? Darren nods, shivers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost there. A force arcs through Darren's body. He screams, falls down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crepsley turns away, starts to lick the blood from his fingertips. Tries to block out Darren's soft whimpering. Tries to block out any sympathy he feels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world will start to slow down. You'll become a witness of time. (snaps out of it) Your friend's time is running out. He pulls Darren to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They step out into the moonlight. Darren a little wobbly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take my arm. Don't let go. Darren takes hold. Crepsley starts to move. Only it seems more like he's still and the ground is moving under his feet. Darren looks about as the building begin to streak past, the road a blurred ribbon. The night has a weird chromatic look. The world moving faster, Crepsley and Darren slipping past. A moment later and they're in the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley pulls loose Darren's hand. They're still bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lick your fingers. Vampire spit will stop wounds from bleeding. Darren looks at his fingers, then around the lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd we get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's called flitting. Which room is your friend in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tubes run in and out of Steve. His breathing is labored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crepsley leans over him, rolls up one of Steve's eyelids. Darren watches as Crespley looks into Steve's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in time. He still has a few minutes left. Crepsley takes a small AMBER VIAL from his pocket. He breaks a wax seal then pinches out a small blackened cork. He pulls the drip line out of the IV CATHETER and empties a drop of the vial's dark, viscous contents inside. It swirls murkily, coloring the liquid on its way into Steve's arm. A beat and then Steve seems to convulse, his arms and legs twitching. Is he dying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was near death. The journey back is not pleasant. What do you know about him, this boy with bad blood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm... Who's his father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never met him. I don't think Steve ever did either. Why do you want to know? And then Steve comes around. He opens his eyes, focuses on Darren for a moment. He looks puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren? And then he drifts off, asleep. His breathing growing deeper, steadier. Darren realizing he's going to be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you come with me now or do you have things to set in order first? That's when it really hits home. He's agreed to leave every- thing and go off with a vampire. Without really thinking, Darren starts backing toward the door, his eyes on Crepsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see... Darren's almost to the door. Crepsley stays where he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run if you want. It won't help. You're a creature of the night now, Darren Shan. Darren turns and bolts leaving Crepsley alone. Chuckling, the vampire tucks Steve's covers up under his chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Darren charges out. Running for his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren asleep in his bed. The door opens and his mom enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren... Wake up, honey. Darren wakes with a start as she gives him a little shake. As he looks about, wonders what reality he's in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just got off the phone. Great news. Steve's going to be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hospital says it's a miracle. Was it a dream? Darren looks down at his hands. On the tip of each finger and two thumbs are small round WHITE SCARS. Darren instinctively hugs his mom. She thinks he's overjoyed, can't see his look of terror. She hugs him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's great news. I know how you feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens and Darren steps out. He takes a long look up and down the street. Nervous. Then he see the sun up in the sky. Relaxes a little. Right... Vampires... Sun. He takes a step down the stairs when... From out of the bushes... SOMEONE LEAPS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boo! Darren nearly jumps out of his skin. Annie laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got you! I finally got you! - Darren turns on her, looks like he could kill her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ever do that again. Annie's smile drops away. As Darren continues on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren walking along, feeling isolated as he moves past the other students. Everything seems weird, off. A couple of KIDS RUSH past him going into a classroom. Then a COUPLE more coming the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Shan, you gotta see this. They duck into the classroom. Darren follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: or so KIDS all pressed around the Boa Constrictor tank. Steve holds court.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .Doctor said it was a miracle. They say I'm unique -- Steve spots Darren as he steps up in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Darren. I've been looking for you. We got a lot to talk about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But first... Steve holds out a fist. A MOUSE pokes its head out through an opening in the hand. Its whiskers twitch. As Darren looks from the mouse to the snake... Steve addresses the kids does his best 'Mr. Tall'. He tries to be entertaining, but he comes off creepy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to Cirque du Steve. What happens to us all can happen to any of us. If you watch, it's by your own free will. Say farewell...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .to Crepsley the mouse. Darren reacts to the name. Steve lowers his hand into the terrarium. Some kids already look away, others are intent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve hesitates. Darren pushes to the front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's cruel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nature. Anyhow don't watch. (TO KIDS) And don't blink; you might miss it. Steve sets the mouse in the terrarium. The MOUSE takes a few tentative steps. Moves toward a corner away from the... SNAKE who's suddenly alert. It raises its head, flicks its tongue. Coils back on itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The snake STRIKES... And Darren darts down his hand! CATCHES the snake just below its head, out of mid-air, out of mid-strike. Impossible! The snake twists in Darren's hand. The students are blown away. Steve's eyes narrow, his wheels are turning. The BELL RINGS. Moment over. Kids hurry out to class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren scoops up the mouse, drops the snake back in. As he starts out, Steve cuts him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to the spider?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed it. Steve hesitates, processes, looks Darren over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a dream. You and Crepsley were in my hospital room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about it later. Darren starts away. Steve grabs him hard, spins him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you now. Darren reacts instinctively, grabs Steve with his free hand and SLAMS him against the wall. Steve's nearly off the ground, only his left toe touching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said later. Darren lets go, heads off. Steve watches, wonders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren walks home, hands in pockets. Annie comes up behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren! Wait up! He looks over his shoulder, keep going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I walk home with you? He softens, slows down. After a few silent steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got you something. Darren pulls the MOUSE from his pocket. Annie loves it, cups it in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's adorable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & DARREN - A CREATURE'S POV Coming in low and fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie SCREAMS as a GERMAN SHEPHERD charges, stops just short of them. GROWLING like it was rabid. Like it hates Darren. Darren steps between it and Annie. Darren's pupils dilate oddly; he curls his lip to show his own teeth. The dog starts to back off..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. That's King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it's not. King's my buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's King, Darren. It is. Darren realizes it is King. As Darren realizes something's wrong with Darren.. Another growl. From down the street. Darren looks back as a black 1966 LINCOLN prowls through the intersection. The one seen at school. It slows, windows blacked out. As it continues, disappears from view...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. As Darren hurries Annie along down the street...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren at the kitchen table doing his math homework. His Mom makes dinner, chopping vegetables at the sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was school today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The usual. Sometimes it was boring, sometimes really boring. Darren's mom laughs. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ouch! She drops the knife on the cutting board. A thick drop of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs down her finger. Darren flinches at the sight and in that moment we PUNCH INTO his eyes. The PUPILS swirl red; the IRISES flatten and narrow. A dark, ravenous look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DARREN'S POV Holding up her finger. Her skin tone receding back into gray, the blood pulsing with red vibrancy. Alive. A target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing at the blood's seeming siren call. But as he suddenly moves forward, she turns away. Darren stops as she wraps her finger in a paper towel. She looks back at him: misunderstands his hunger for concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, honey. I just need a band-aid. Darren looks at his mom's neck. His eyes zero in on a little blue VEIN PULSING away. She leaves the room to get a band- aid. As Darren's horror sinks in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren looks at his reflection in the MIRROR. Looking for reassurance. He curls his lip, checks his teeth. They look normal. He reaches out. Trying to reach himself. His hand comes to a stop against the glass. His nails CLICK hard against the surface. He scrapes the nail of his forefinger along the glass. It leaves a deep scratch. Darren starts to freak a little. His breath getting ragged. He tries to get a hold of himself, looks back in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're different...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren walks down an aisle, climbs up onto the empty stage. Dark, but Darren moves calmly, like it was noon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Hey! Crepsley appears. Darren turns, sees him. A beat. Crepsley raises his hands to the gloom around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The darkness isn't so scary anymore, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm starting to think it's me that's scary. Crepsley waits to hear more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only gonna get worse, isn't it? There's no way back, is there? No magic potion to make me human again? Crepsley shakes his head. Darren nods that he understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We made a deal. I won't run away again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's neither here nor there, but, I do feel sorry for you. Darren waves it off, doesn't want to hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ready then? The night is young. We can make many miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't just -- My family, I can't let them think I just left them. Or that something happened to me. My mother would... She couldn't... As Darren trails off, Crepsley really does look sympathetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only one thing for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's parents watching CNN. Darren comes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to bed. They say 'good night' to him. Impulsively, Darren kisses his dad on the cheek, then does the same to his mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you both. I don't say it that much, but I do. Darren's Mom is caught off guard, but happy to hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We love you, too. Don't we, Tommy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course we do. Darren looks at them a beat, then smiles, satisfied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. They watch him go, then exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kids. Who knows how they think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Annie asleep already. Darren enters, pulls his sister's blanket up, tucks it under her chin. He whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, knucklehead. If I can ever help you, I will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren enters to find Crepsley sitting at his desk. He holds a small dark bottle between his fingers (different than the one he gave to Steve). As Crepsley's about to speak...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. Off Crepsley's reaction...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my home and I'm never gonna see it again, so don't rush me. Crepsley makes a motion to zip his lips. All the same, he stands, unscrews the bottle as Darren takes a last look around. He takes a PHOTO of his family off the dresser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold onto this for me, okay? Crepsley takes the photo, offers Darren the bottle in return. Darren sniffs, recoils at the foul smell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sure it will work? Crepsley opens the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your heart will slow down so drastically they won't find a pulse. With the fall from the window, they'll think you're dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I break bones?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even better. They'll mend in a few days. Vampires don't stay broken for long and it takes a very long fall to kill one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the funeral home? Won't they embalm me or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. I have ways of making my thoughts become the thoughts of others. They'll leave you alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crepsley gestures to the window. Knowing the plan, Darren climbs out, his foot resting on the trellis. He looks to the ground, back to Crepsley as an odd thought hits him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad's allergic to grass. It's my job to cut the lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a new job now. Drink. Darren steels himself, gulps it down, hands the bottle back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this is destiny, huh? Tastes like crap. Darren body seizes up. He lets go, but Crepsley grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your breathing is slowing, your heart as well. Do you feel it? Darren can't answer. He blinks his eyes 'yes' instead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may be aware of what's going on around you. Remember, the grief that you hear will be a release for those who express it. Darren's eyes drift shut. Crepsley lets him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren FALLS, crashes through the trellis and thumps into the lawn. Crepsley looks down from the window, then disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Darren lying face down in the grass. CRICKETS chirp. Beyond, a NEIGHBOR walks his DOG. The dog suddenly turns in the direction of Darren, pulls on its leash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, come on -- The Neighbor stops short as he sees the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- Hey, kid -- He rolls Darren over, realizes something is very wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We stay on Darren, the dog sniffing at him as the neighbor disappears toward the front door. We hear his fist pound. A moment later, Darren's father is there. He looks at Darren, up to the open window, realizes he fell. An instant later, he's on his knees, cradling his son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren? Darren! A moment later his Mom...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren! Oh my God! We're still on Darren's face, his eye open a slit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His parents hovering over him in despair. The STARS TWINKLE. The neighbor leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's body on a stainless steel table. The MEDICAL EXAMINER shakes his head sadly, looks to his ASSISTANT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause of death is trauma from the impact of the fall. Poor kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we doing an autopsy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reveals Crepsley watching from around a darkened corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not on a child. Immediately...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to cut open a kid. Not when I don't have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - EARLY EVENING Darren in his coffin, wearing a suit. Aware as... Friends and family passing by. The sounds of people crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from school lean in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always had a crush on him. The Goalie from school soccer is next. He holds a little
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in his hand. Tucks it into the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the next life, Shan. Top right corner every time. Annie steps up, gently strokes her brother's cheek. Then suddenly overwhelmed, she buries her face in their Dad's chest. He leans in tenderly over his son. Choked up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, Darren. You said it the other night; I didn't say it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME - NIGHT PEOPLE leave. Visiting hours are over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hand reaches down, a thumb opens his eyelid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of the ceiling for a moment, then a blinding light flashing back and forth. Then glimpses of Steve's face!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve holds Darren's eye open, shines a PENLIGHT into it. The pupil doesn't dilate. Footsteps approach. Steve switches it off, pockets it as the FUNERAL DIRECTOR enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I know it's difficult, but visiting hours are over. Steve nods sadly, looks to Darren. He pats one of Darren's hands which are folded across his chest. In reality Steve checks Darren's fingertips. A WHITE SCAR at the end of each one. Steve's crazy idea may be confirmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's coffin is lowered into the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashes to ashes, dust to dust, in sure and certain hope of the resurrection to come... Darren's Dad tosses a handful of earth down onto the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D COFFIN The lid an inch from his face. His eyelid twitching as we hear shovelfuls of dirt hit the lid. The sound growing duller at each turn. Then, as Darren's eye flickers open...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moonless. The sound of digging continues. Only now, dirt is coming out of the hole rather than going in. Crepsley is digging the coffin back up. Effortlessly. Finally, he spreads his feet apart, pulls open the lid. Darren sputters as some of the dirt spills onto his face. Crepsley reaches down, pulls him up and out of the grave. Darren sits on the ground, coughing then moaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My legs are asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crepsley pulls him up anyhow. Darren stumbles a few steps, nearly falls before finding his balance.
direction.name: direction
