direction.raw_text: Walk it off. I'll fill this back in. Go. Breathe some air. Crepsley closes the coffin, begins to fill the hole as Darren ambles off. Not exactly the start of his best day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Passing among the graves, stretching his arms, twisting. Really beat up. He looks about, the names and dates on the headstones popping into focus even from far away. Night vision. Suddenly he becomes aware of something: Steve. On the other side of a mausoleum. Ten feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles; closing in) Vampire hunting. Steve rushes the last step, a jagged WOODEN STAKE held high over his head. He knocks Darren back on the ground. Pouncing on top, he brings down the stake. Darren catches hold of Steve's wrist. Stops the point of the stake just over his heart. Steve puts his weight into it. A desperate moment of struggle, but Darren's strength is resurgent. He throws Steve off. Steve rolls to his feet, comes at him again. Darren catches his wrist with one hand, his throat with the other. He slams him up against the mausoleum, holds him there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you have against vampires? You wanted to become one yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I wanted to, but you did. You stole my dream. You stole my destiny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? I did it to save your life. That was the deal. Me for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar. You told him I was evil. You planned this all along. And you'll pay! You'll pay -- Darren jams the stake under Steve's throat. That stops him struggling. The points jabs him as he swallows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to leave... Steve is just beginning to realize how strong Darren is now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to leave and forget you ever saw me. Understand? Scared, he nods. Darren shoves him away, brakes the stake in two. Steve heads away, looks back over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to hunt you, Darren. You and the other one. Crepsley. I'll put a stake in you and burn you to ashes. I'll make sure you never come back from the grave again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve walks right into Crepsley. He picks Steve up by the shoulders, pulls him close. With a voice like Death...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we ever meet again, I will show you loneliness you cannot imagine. Steve trembles in fear. Crepsley lets go. Steve takes off running. Crepsley looks to Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you still question his blood? Darrenthoughtful, doesn't know what to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would a stake through the heart kill a vampire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. But so would getting hit by a truck if it was going fast enough. Steve finally disappears from sight. Crepsley sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be trouble before it's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before what's over?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This adventure we're on. Shall we start? Darren hesitates, looks to the twinkling lights of his city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get used to it after awhile. Vampires are always saying goodbye. A beat, then Darren looks back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it blisters up into, then rises above the horizon. Sunrise. Ominous if you're a full vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the edge of the highway. Silhouetted against the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren jams a rolled towel along the bottom of a closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that? Dark enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on the other side) Better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's sunrise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know the time. I know more about the sunrise than anyone alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crespley sounds irritated. Darren gets mischievous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I'll wait until noon and then open every door and curtain in the place. A long tense silence as Darren awaits Crepsley's reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley is a shadow among the shadows. He climbs into bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sunlight would kill me. My electrons are different than a human's. But it would take several hours of exposure. I'd have plenty of time to kill you before I closed the curtains and went back to bed. Crepsley pulls the blanket up over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Darren considers this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren doing pull-ups, a hand on either side of the top jamb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 243... 244... It's almost effortless. Bored rather than tired, Darren drops to his feet. (He still wears his burial suit.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren watching the cars go by on the highway, spots...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minnesota... Darren jots this state down on a LIST he's keeping. About twenty state license plates so far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: droning. Darren asleep. Bathed in a golden glow that flickers out as the sun sets. The bedroom door opens. Crepsley steps over, looks down at his snoozing assistant. Crepsley CLAPS his hands together, nearly against Darren's ear. Crepsley smiles as Darren jolts awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting late, stores closing. The parking lot nearly empty. Darren and Crepsley are on a walk and talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can die violently. Accidentally or otherwise. But we also grow old. A full vampire will age one year for every ten human years he's alive. A half-vampire like you: one for every five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was born in 1774. I became -- Crepsley looks back to where Darren has stopped short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we do the math or not? Darren nods. Crepsley motions him to keep up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I became a vampire when I was 20 years old. In 1794.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Paris. The days of the Terror. Heads in baskets. Guillotines up and down all day. Really when humans put their minds to it, we vampires can hardly compete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren's stare jogs him back from the good old days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Math. 1794. So I've been a vampire now for 211 years. Hmm? Darren nods again, still with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I age 1 year for every 10, so, 211 divided by 10, I've aged about 21 years in that time. That 21 plus my first human 20 makes me look about 40.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But altogether you're 211 plus 20. You're really 231 years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. You're going to be a teenager for a very long time. They walk on a few steps as Darren thinks this over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you keep your car anyhow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one you were driving around my town in. The old black one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never owned a car, Darren. I don't need one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was near school one day. It followed me home a few days later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you saw me behind the wheel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't see who was driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't me. As Darren considers this, Crepsley stops suddenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There... Ahead: just more parking lot. A WOMAN exiting a BOOKSTORE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman nears her car. A chirp as she unlocks it with her remote. She opens the back door, sets the book bag on the seat. Suddenly she turns, like someone called her name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? Only nobody's there. She shrugs it off, closes the back door. But hesitates at the driver's side door. Then she starts walking away, toward a back area of loading docks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch from a dumpster by the loading dock. She walks right toward them. One look at Crepsley's face and we know he must be willing her over. Darren looks terrified. But the air shimmers and Crepsley has disappeared. The woman steps up, stops across from Darren. As she frowns, tries to figure out who he is and how she got here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go. Run. But Crepsley appears beside her. He 'breathes' into his hand, 'guides' the air into her face. He catches her as she passes out. Darren is horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you kill her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I put her to sleep. She'll be like this 15 minutes. When she wakes up, she won't remember a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crepsley eases her to the ground, finds a vein on her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will she become a vampire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She'd have to share y blood for that to happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't take too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vampire who feeds often can control himself. One who drinks only when he must can end up feeding wildly. He uses one of his fingernails to open the vein.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hunger inside us must be fed to be controlled. To be civilized. It's what separates us from... the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What others? But as blood oozes, he takes the woman's wrist td his mouth. Darren is repulsed, but can't look away. Crepsley takes a few deep swallows, then holds the wrist out to Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never do it. Crepsley runs his tongue over the cut, rubs the saliva in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can lead a vampire to blood, but you can't make him drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only half-vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No matter, you need blood to live now. You'll drink eventually. When you're hungry enough. The wrist is clean, the cut gone. A barely perceptible scar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll die first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be stupid. You may abstain tonight, but you must feed soon. Crepsley stands to go, then stops short. Tense, he looks about, more hunted animal than man. As he shrugs it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? As the woman starts to stir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something out there scares you. What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The thought of spending another minute with you. Crepsley turns and walks, but Darren's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WAITRESS sets a juicy BURGER down across from Darren. Crepsley sits across from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We still need to eat food, too. I just don't need it tonight. Darren just sits there. Silently as tears begin to run down his cheeks. Crepsley is exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blood... I wanted it. I wanted to drink it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you did! You're a Crepsley catches himself. He is not without some compassion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. It was wrong of me to blood you. You're too young. But it's done. Like the entire history of the world up to this moment. Darren quietly cries. Crepsley pulls two paper napkins from the dispenser, hands them to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Darren turns to face the window as he wipes his eyes, nose. Then he sees it: parked across and down the street... A black 1966 Lincoln Continental. Darren looks back at Crepsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat. Let's not waste anymore food tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car... Crepsley follows the finger as Darren points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The bell over the diner door rings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he looks back over his shoulder at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MR. TINY comes through the front door pimpin'. Peter Lorre on steroids. Scary, done up like a Las Vegas high roller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren knows trouble when he sees it. He looks back at Crepsley, but the vampire is gone! Vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY (STEPPING UP) Darren Shan, we meet at last. Darren just looks up at him. The guy is practically leaking nastiness no matter how avuncular he tries to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY You're quite a boy. Sacrificed everything to save a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you hear that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY A little bat told me. Mr. Tiny takes a french fry off Darren's plate, eats it. Darren looks around. Where the hell did Crepsley go at a time like this? Mr. Tiny knows what he's thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Oh, he's still here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Crepsley. Trying to stay alive. It's so quiet around them Darren can hear a clock TICKING. It's a heart shaped POCKET WATCH Mr. Tiny holds on a chain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Would you like to see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what? The air seems to buzz as something 'passes'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Why the fight of course. Boys like to watch fights, don't they? Mr. Tiny hefts his watch. It almost seems to melt into his palm. As he pulls the winding knob out with a CLICK... As Darren and Mr. Tiny blink out, disappear from the booth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Mr. Tiny reappear in the booth, but the restaurant's patrons are slowed to near motionlessness.A battle royal going on. Crepsley fighting three VAMPANEZE. All three are sinewy, whipcords with blotchy purple skin. Crepsley stands surrounded in the middle of the restaurant. Whirling, hand fighting. Blocking their thrusts and blows. Darren moves to stand. Mr. Tiny pushes him back to his seat. Crepsley takes one down with a violent leg whip. He drives the second one back into the third knocking both back. A look to Darren and then he's back on LEG WHIP who's getting to his feet. Crepsley drives his flat hand forward, his nails tearing into the vampaneze's throat. As leg whip's hand instinctively goes to his throat to stem the blood, Crepsley grabs his free hand, sends him airborne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As leg whip 'unflits'. The patrons react to him soaring over the counter, slamming into the wall -- CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The patrons near frozen again. Leg whip sliding ever so slowly down the wall. Crepsley and Sinewy One & Two FIGHTING at full speed. Sinewy One pulls Crepsley's arm up behind his back. Crepsley
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as we hear the bone BREAK. Mr. Tiny grabs Darren by the wrist, pulls him toward the door. Behind them... Crepsley drives the back of his head into Sinewy One's face at the same time as Sinewy Two swings in his open palm... Sinewy One releases Crepsley who disappears as Sinewy Two slices open Sinewy One's throat. As Mr. Tiny pulls Darren out the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley appears. Leg Whip hits the floor. Blood splashes the wall as Sinewy One appears, dropping to his knees. As Leg Whip stands, Crepsley charges, 'shoulders' him halfway through the wall. Patrons SCREAM, react, scatter. As Crepsley grabs a knife...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren struggles as Mr. Tiny pulls him along. Behind, through the diner windows, WE SEE Patrons frozen in flight. Sinewy Two near frozen in fight with Crepsley who is in mid swing with the knife in his head. Mr. Tiny and Darren stop across from YOUNG MURLOUGH. Humanoid in shape, monstrous in visage. Bloated, his skin albino white with purplish mottling and red crisscrossing veins. He must weigh 300 pounds, but NFL nose tackle style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smell the blood. The lovely blood. His eyes narrow at the sight of Crepsley, his mouth widening to show two rows of sharp filthy teeth. Darren needs to do something. He eyes the watch in Mr. Tiny's hand. He grabs it with his free hand, thumbs back in the winding knob. As Murlough disappears from view... The WINDOW EXPLODES as Sinewy Two hurtles out. Darren tosses the watch high in the air. Mr. Tiny releases him to move to catch it. Darren rushes back toward the restaurant. Mr. Tiny catches his watch. Crepsley meets Darren. Crepsley's broken arm hangs uselessly from his side. Murlough appears alongside. He grabs Crepsley by the throat, lifts him off the ground. Crepsley arcs the knife into Murlough's shoulder. Murlough staggers, lets go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Crepsley takes Darren's hand and they flit, disappearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beyond the hamburger joint. The world beginning to streak past them. The asphalt begins to blur beneath their feet, passing cars like they were standing still. But Crepsley heaves for breath. In pain. Darren looks back over his shoulder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough follows. Closing ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's behind us! Crepsley bears down, the buildings streaking by. But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Closes regardless, relentless, death in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost out of gas. But looking ahead. Clocks in an instant: a RED LIGHT AHEAD. Cars STOPPED. A CAR FROZEN having just crossed the INTERSECTION. HEADLIGHTS from a blind corner. Crepsley slows. Just as Murlough's about to catch him from behind... Crepsley comes out of flit mode, disappears. As Murlough FADES after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Crepsley appear on the far side of the crossing. Murlough comes out of flit in the center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The headlights Crepsley saw frozen, but coming from the blind corner, become a PICK-UP - broadsiding Murlough! He goes up over the hood, SMASHES against the windshield. As Darren and Murlough disappear again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The pick-up brakes. Murlough doesn't. He tumbles off the hood, sprawls hard into and skids along the street. A beat and he rolls to a sitting position, looks around. No Crepsley in sight. Blood runs out of one of his ears. As he wipes it, smearing it across his cheek...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, man, are you okay?! He stops short when he sees Murlough's face. Murlough stands, SWATS the driver aside. The Lincoln screeches to a halt alongside him. Murlough climbs in. The Lincoln tearing away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky getting lighter. A SIGN: Now Entering Pennsylvania. The air shimmers as something flits past... WHOOOSHH!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boarded up. Abandoned. Clutching his arm, Mr. Crepsley kicks at the door, splinters it. Opens"a gap. Darren reaches through, unlocks it. As they step inside, the first rays of the sun appear through the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley climbs down a few steps, closes the door behind him. Barely any light, but some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find a blanket. A rug. Cover it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren drags a CARPET over the root cellar door in the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It goes black except for a glint in Crepsley's eyes. He sighs, settles down on the ground. Worn out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My arm's broken. But it should be fine in a day or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Sunlight fills the kitchen. Darren sits, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who were they? Vampires?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. The one with the watch was Mr. Tiny. Very dangerous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How dangerous can a man named Mr. Tiny be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said he was a man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Tiny can't be explained. He needs to be experienced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the purple guy. What was he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vampaneze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Keep talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long ago humans were looked upon as animals by some vampires. Cattle to be slaughtered. Laws were passed to forbid needless killing. It made it easier to pass unnoticed among humans if we didn't murder them. Most vampires obeyed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But some didn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy vampires broke away, declared themselves a separate race. The Vampaneze. Over time their appearance changed, their numbers grew. They believe it's wrong to feed from a human without killing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? That's crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They believe those of us who feed in small amounts live like leeches. In shame. It led to war. Crepsley touches the scar on his face, remembers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last one nearly destroyed us all. There's been a truce for many years now. (A BEAT) Will you be alright while I sleep? Darren looks around at the dilapidated crap heap he's in. As he tries to hold his heart together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah... This is so much better than where I used to be... Crepsley hears the strain in his voice. Knows what's best for both of them..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think of rejoining the Cirque du Freak? Until you get on your vampire feet so to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes. Three-eighths if you want. What do you think? As Darren thinks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL'S AIRSTREAM TRAILER - NIGHT The Cirque is camped by an ABANDONED FACTORY. Neo-Gothic in scale and mood. Lit up for a performance. Mr. Tall, pulls on his jacket, shouts orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Show time in twenty minutes. Someone tell Rhamus to get his stomachs in gear! He's surprised to see Crepsley and Darren walk up the road. Crepsley's arm seems much better now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Larten'Crepsley! As I live and breathe. I thought it would be years before I saw you again. Mr. Tall looks to Darren, throws a surprised look to Crepsley. Crepsley nods. 'Yes'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Darren Shan. You've come a long way since the last time I saw you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I liked it better where I was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL I'm sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you still have my coffin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Of course. You're really back? (CREPSLEY NODS) Perhaps you could do the show tonight? A few of us are absent or ill this evening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be delighted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Mr. Shan will have to pull his weight as well. I'll give him to Evra. Evra! EVRA! (LOOKING ABOUT) I hope I haven't gone from one unreliable boy to two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Evra arrives. The snake boy from the first Cirque show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Evra, my industrious wonder. Here is Darren. Put him to work with you. Show him the snakey ropes. As the two boys consider each other...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Off with you. Go! As the boys head off, Mr. Tall looks over at Crepsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL You blooded a child, Larten? What were you thinking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't approve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL I don't matter. What will the vampire generals say when they hear about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm no longer part of their domain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL So you say. They may disagree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Darren and Evra make their way through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you do? Me? I'm a snake boy. I do a whole snake thing. Evra goes into a slithery snake walk for a few steps to illustrate. It's strange. Funny. Evra looks back over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you eat mice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big Macs actually. They share a LAUGH. Evra 'high fives' Darren. Fast friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As they continue, Darren looks at the palm of his hand. A few of Evra's SCALES have come off and are stuck there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I caught your act in the last town. Pretty cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. I'm not doing it tonight. My snake caught a cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snakes can catch cold? Evra nods, then SNEEZES himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still gotta work the floor though. Ushers. We get the seats filled. They pass PEOPLE all hurriedly crossing the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are they all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The backbone of Cirque du Freak. They do the driving, the tent pitching, the potato peeling even.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did they end up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most wandered in. If Mr. Tall likes them, they stay. Darren's eye is caught by the WOLFMAN. He's being pushed toward the factory building by several of the blue-robed
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The wolfman's yellow eyes are on Darren as he rumbles a low, guttural growl. Darren is so taken that he almost walks into... Madam Truska. He stops short. In costume, beardless, even more beautiful than when we first saw her. She considers Darren, uses a finger to raise his chin. She shakes her head, smiles. As she continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An odd setting, but it works well. Stripped, ragged, weird. Feels like a rave. The lighting dramatic, the concrete walls ominous. PATRONS take their seat around a stage. A buzz in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About the same age as Darren and Evra, they're here for the show. Debbie is self-assured. Sam is sarcastic to cover his insecurities. Right now it's hard to find a seat. And here are Darren and Evra. Evra looking cool in his green sharkskin, Darren still wearing his burial suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we help you find a seat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are there any left?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the best seats in the house. He leads them a few steps over toward a column.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are with the Cirque? Darren nods. Sam's a little sarcastic and skeptical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cirque is French, right? Are you guys French?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oui. Vous etes observateur. Nous sommes les serpents frangais. That slows Sam a beat. Evra points out a small platform eight feet up the column. You have to climb a natural re-bar ladder to get there. Sam looks dubious, but Debbie smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool... I'm Debbie, this is Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evra Von. She looks at Darren, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the show great? Say yes. We had to sneak out to see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I snuck out to see it once, too. And I'm still here. An odd, almost spooky moment. Is he serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good one, Darren. Hey. Debbie and Darren. Like Bonnie and Clyde. And their friend Evra Von what? That breaks the moment. Debbie starts climbing the re-bar. Sam looks Darren over a beat, picks a thread off his lapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dude, it looks like the kind of suit you'd wear to a funeral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have no idea... Evra smiles, sticks out his tongue. Pointy, narrow, Evra sends it up his own nostril. Sam tries to smile, then starts up after Debbie. Freaked out. As Darren and Evra laugh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Tall under a spotlight. Back in his red hat and gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Welcome to the Cirque du Freak. We are an ancient circus. Bringing the remarkable to generations...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Evra watch from the back, whisper to each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long have you known Mr. Tall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you meet someone like him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was raised in a circus, but not a nice one like this. The owner used to beat me and keep me in a glass cage. I felt like a useless freak. One night I looked out of my cage and saw Mr. Tall just standing there. He watched me until the owner came over and asked if he could help him. Mr. Tall grabbed him by the throat and strangled him to death. Then he opened the cage and said, "Let's go, Evra." He named me that. I added the Von. I've been with him ever since. Darren looks back at Mr. Tall with a new set of eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren... Darren turns. Crepsley's back there in the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you feel about show business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The audience reacts as Crepsley 'appears' on the empty stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be poisoned by a spider may be my fate. It's Darren's cue. Looking appropriate in his burial suit, he walks out carrying Madam Octa's cage at arm's length.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she realizes it's Darren. Cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren sees Debbie who gives a little wave. As he smiles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look glum... Miserable...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren loses the grin. Crepsley opens the cage. Madam Octa steps to the opening. Crespley raises the flute, plays. Madam Octa walks out and up to Darren's shoulder where she attaches a web thread. The audience react as she leaps to Crepsley's shoulder and attaches the other end. She dances across to the music, spinning a web as she goes. Darren looks out, sees how much Debbie enjoys it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set against the black sky. Sparks rise up, their source unknown. All very mysterious until... LAUGHTER. Lots of it. Borderline raucous. We follow the sparks DOWN to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blazing in the Cirque campgrounds. The freaks are eating, drinking wine, relaxing after the show. Like a gypsy camp. Mr. Tall sits with his long legs up on a box, really enjoying watching everyone else enjoy themselves. Evra munches on a sausage he grills on the end of a stick. Darren is all ears and eyes. He likes these people. And he's certainly never experienced anything like this. Someone starts to play a guitar, someone else beats a drum. Madam Truska starts to dance, the fire flickering against her as are all eyes. Then she reaches out, takes Crepsley by the hand. A few moments later, the two of them are engaged in a mad TANGO. It takes the camp's collective breath away. Even Darren can't help but enjoy it. Crepsley's arm gives him a twinge or two, but only Truska notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mattress on the floor inside. Using tape and cardboard, Darren 'blacks out' the windows. Crepsley steps over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost done. Crepsley looks to the sky. Still dark. The moon setting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren... (Darren looks over) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to sleep here. We'll find a nook in the factory. Crepsley starts off. Darren starts to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mattress. Darren sighs, goes back to the van to retrieve the mattress. He starts to pull it out, then stops, nearly doubled over. Concerned, Crepsley steps over. Darren waves him off, straightens as whatever it was passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just felt sick for a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need blood. Darren gives him a dirty look, grabs the mattress. They start walking toward the factory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SHADOWS of a loading dock. Crepsley and Darren approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think Mr. Tiny might come? Crepsley shrugs, doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he? What does he want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we want is who we are, don't you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you give me a straight answer just once?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't learn by me telling you. You must live some things to know what they are. Darren sighs in deep frustration. Crepsley has a thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Why do you like spiders?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darren tires to figure what he's getting at? Implying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever think there was a particular reason? It seems Crepsley knows the answer even if Darren doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I never thought about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the trouble with children. They don't think about things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a child. Theystop by the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you a man? If you're not a man, you're a child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in between.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In between does not exist! The words echo a moment. Darren no closer to understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll sleep in here tonight. But sit outside the van tomorrow and make it look like I'm there. It's just caution. Old habits die hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And old vampires? Without a sound, someone has reached around the two of them from behind, a RAZOR-KNIFE held to each of their throats. They stand dead still. We can make out the shape of a head as whoever it is leans in ever so slightly from the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gavner Purl, as always I heard you coming from a mile away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! In his hand by his side, Mr. Crepsley holds a thin
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He presses the steel back ever so slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll call it a draw then. The 'voice' pulls back his knives, steps out. It's GAVNER PURL. He was once handsome, but those days are long gone. His face is crossed with scars. They vary in size, thickness and color. Gavner is a warrior, carries himself so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been too long, Larten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Decades now. They embrace. Darren's trying to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose. We once shared a coffin together. For six months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like roommates? To save money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were being hunted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was hunting you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind. Darren, Gavner Purl. Gavner extends his hand to shake. Darren sees'the scars on Gavner Purl's fingertips. Darren raises his own hand so Gavner can see his scars. Gavner looks at Crepsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A half-vampire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. We don't make full vampires of our assistants. Gavner Purl looks at Crepsley, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nor do we make assistants of children. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (LOSING IT) A child, Larten? Why?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have my reasons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't owe answers to vampires anymore. I'm exiled from our kind
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Self-exiled. And I at least am owed an answer. There's a personal history being called upon here. Crepsley is well aware. Darren again is left out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I care to say is a boy sought me out, knew who I was. He asked me to make him my assistant. Gavner looks to Darren, suspicious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how did you know -- CREPSLEY (INTERRUPTS) It wasn't Darren. Another boy. His blood was bad. I should have killed him, but I didn't. Darren reacts. Gavner considers it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met Darren shortly after. His blood was good or I certainly would have killed him. Darren reacts again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could a boy find you? Crepsley shrugs. Of course he had help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tiny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tried to kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tried to kill me. What he wanted with you wasn't determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps you chose the wrong boy. In Mr. Tiny's eyes. A moment as they consider the unspoken implications.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you guys talking about!? No answer as Crepsley and Gavner lock each other in a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's important enough to track down an exile? What is your news?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: War.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not interested in your wars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well the other side is interested or they wouldn't be trying to get rid of you. Crepsley gets suddenly very angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had enough killing! No more! You've come to the wrong place. I am the wrong place... Gavner raises his hands in surrender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even so, I'm glad you're alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun is coming. Will you stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can still make miles. The war won't wait. And neither will bad news. I have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then travel safely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you mind if I walk a bit with your assistant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take him with you if you want. He's of little use to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Gavner Purl walk. Gavner looks him over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look sick. Doesn't Larten feed you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't drink blood if that's what you mean. I promised myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get insulted. As Gavner waits for Darren to tell him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid if I drink blood, I'll become evil. Gavner LAUGHS out loud, catches himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The only thing drinking blood will do to you is keep you alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how it would start. I would swear it was just to stay alive. But what'll I turn into? You're on one side of the fence or the other. My father used to say that and now I know what he meant. The 'father part' chokes Darren up a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've already turned, Darren. You need to accept what you've already become. There's no going back. They walk in silence a moment. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did Crepsley make himself an exile anyhow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was tired of all the killing. We were at war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the vampaneze?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley was once a Vampire General. One of our great leaders. He may seem reluctant, but I assure you, no one is as skilled at killing vampaneze than Crepsley is. I think that's why they'd like to get him out of the way. Kill him off before the new war starts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've known him a long time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was his assistant. He blooded me, as he blooded you. There's almost something comforting in this news. Gavner Purl so proud and strong looking. Darren wants to know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd he choose you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To teach me to kill vampaneze. Up until now, it's the only reason he ever chooses anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it why he chose me? Gavner hesitates, not sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for Crepsley to say. Not me. Another brick wall, but Darren accepts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what the biggest danger is to a vampire, Darren?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vampaneze? Mr. Tiny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's that they live so long they no longer care. Everything they love is left behind until they finally have nothing left to live for. Except death. The fact that he's taken an apprentice seems, to me, a good sign. A sign that he's thinking of living not dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky for me. Glad I could help. All the same Darren considers what he's heard. Gavner, meanwhile, considers the open countryside ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A clear run. Good. Gavner gives Darren one last appraising look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay by him, Darren. Stay by him. Gavner takes a deep breath. The air around him shimmers, his image bouncing in and out of phase like an electron heating up. And then he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That part is definitely cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High in the noon sky. PAN DOWN to where Darren stands under a tree by the old van. He concentrates, looks himself over. Nothing. He concentrates again. He's trying to flit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Very briefly -- the air shimmers around him -- then stops. He looks at his arms. Little WISPS of smoke come off them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's smells like burnt hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know. I'm congested. (SEES SOMETHING) Hey... Evra follows his gaze, turns just in time to see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debbie and Sam ducking inside the factory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exchange a look. Start after them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the show was the night before. Light streams down from gaps in the decrepit roof. No sight of Debbie and Sam as Darren and Evra make their way in.- They pause at a CREAKING coming from somewhere overhead. As they move...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren and Evra come off a rickety staircase, pass through a half-rotted door. There are holes in the roof overhead and huge gaps on the floor where the boards have fallen through. They see Sam, his back to them, staring out a smashed window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's scare the crap out of him... They begin to creep in, flanking the unsuspecting Sam. But as they get close, a SHAPE drops down behind them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Darren and Evra are the ones who jump. The shape is Debbie! She almost falls over laughing. So does Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should see the look on your faces. But Evra and Darren are not laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could ask you the same thing. We come here all the time. My grandfather used to work here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must've been a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says now it's like one of those bombed out World War II cathedrals. Empty of what is used to be. An odd little moment till Sam breaks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, we loved the show, man. It was off the hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (messing with him) Off the hook, huh? I'll tell all the freaks you said so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you guys on your own? Just traveling. No parents or nothing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No parents. He says it with a little twinge that Debbie picks up on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: School?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No school either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the luckiest guys on earth. Wanna switch places?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to be different to be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Different how? Evra steps into a slash of sunlight and his skin flashes to life, the green of his scales catching the rays. Debbie's mouth drops. They couldn't see it in the dark last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone has a place they belong. The Cirque du Freak is ours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think your skin is beautiful. That wins Evra over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I touch it? Evra holds out his arm. Debbie traces a finger across it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Has it always been this way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a snake-boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't call him names because he looks different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I am a snake boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could say you're dermatologically challenged. They all LAUGH. Debbie considers Evra a beat, then Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you, Darren? How are you different?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I get scared easy. Darren looks up toward the rafters. From where she dropped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get up there anyhow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, how did a girl get up there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A spot where the roofing is gone, several long RAFTERS stretch out. Darren, Evra and Sam watch Debbie walk out on one. Like a balance beam. The factory floor 70 feet below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, be careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. She's like a gymnast. Debbie moves slowly at first, her arms stretched out for balance. Then she does a hop, a skip. Darren and Evra gasp. She gets to the other side, turns and bows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got nothing to prove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it'd be easier for you than me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because chickens have wings. She starts chicken CLUCKING. Mad, Darren steps onto a rafter, starts across. He stops in the middle, spins around. Aided immeasurably by his half-vampire skills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Debbie is impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vertigo angle as Debbie walks back out on her rafter. Stops about 4-feet across from Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren crosses his arms across his chest. No big deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's play mirrors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do something and you have to copy me. Like this. Debbie crosses her arms the same way Darren has. He uncrosses them as he realizes. Debbie reaches down, touches her toes. Darren sighs, then does the same, gets a good look at the floor below. Debbie takes one foot off the rafter, takes hold of the top of it with one hand, raising the other arm out for balance. Looks like a ballerina. Evra doesn't like this daredevil stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, guys... Darren hesitates. Not because he won't do it, but because maybe for the first time in his life, he's really fascinated by a girl. Debbie misreads, starts CLUCKING again. Darren smiles, repeats her move effortlessly. Without warning, Debbie leaps the gap, lands on the rafter alongside Darren. As she struggles a bit for balance, Darren reaches out and steadies her. As they come face to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There definitely something different about you. I just can't figure it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Sam your boyfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my cousin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... A funny, awkward beat out on the rafter. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should get off this. She nods, a bit smitten. Darren turns. As they start off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chalk it up to lack of blood, but everything starts spinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The area is like a big drain and he's whirling down it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren legs go out and he falls off. As Debbie screams... Darren CATCHES HOLD of the rafter just as he drops past it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on. Debbie grabs his arm. Evra starts out to help, but the rafter CREAKS OMINOUSLY. He stops. Sam states the obvious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it'll hold you, dude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the heads up... Bro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes it off) It's okay. I'm okay. Darren swings up a leg, hooks it over the rafter. A beat and he's back on top. Debbie relieved. Evra backs up the way he came and in a few seconds they're all safely off the rafter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how you hung on. I couldn't have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't have fallen in the first place... I just got dizzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you need to eat something. Darren looks at her. She has no idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the food's down on ground level. Let's get out of here. Sam and Debbie start off, Darren and Evra following. As Sam and Debbie start down a ladder, Darren hangs back a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's kind'of cool, huh? I mean, for a girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like her. She asks a lot of questions though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's just curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no such thing as 'just' with a girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you such an expert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My snake's a girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun peeps below the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren walks along, flashlight in hand. Going somewhere. He suddenly stops, listens, not sure if he heard something. A following FOOTSTEP?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren as he continues. As he passes through a doorway, he ducks around the corner. Waits a few beats. Then he leaps out to see who's following. No one's there. Shaking his head, he continues on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren knocks on a door, waits a beat before it opens and Crepsley emerges from his sleeping place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's good about it? Crepsley looks him over, doesn't like what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bustling with activity. Nearly show time. Crepsley stands by an open tent flap watching Darren cross camp. Not well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops as Sam and Debbie catch up with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Darren. Hi... Darren's happy to see them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are coming to the show again tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Evra's doing his snake act tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you came to see Evra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you... Darren smiles shyly at that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was hoping for Amanda Bynes. Darren sees Crepsley watching him from the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'll catch up with you later. I got some stuff I gotta finish up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They watch as Darren heads off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna be gone in another day or two. Tonight's the last show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So stop looking at him like you love him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're such an idiot, Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren joins Crepsley, a little unsteady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you. You can barely stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to feed. You need blood..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I won't let you hunt some poor person down for me. I -- Crepsley grabs hold of Darren, hauls him into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark, the inside walls richly embroidered. Medieval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to hunt. There's someone here willing to save you. From the shadows: Madam Truska. Startlingly beautiful. She steps up. Eyes on Darren, she offers Crepsley her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By my own free will, Darren Shan. As Crepsley's fingernail hovers, ready to open a vein. Darren shakes his head. 'No'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drink or you'll die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I can't. I'm human. Crepsley releases Truska's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not! And you'll be nothing! Darren stands there as noble and sad as a boy could be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am human. In my heart I am. A great big TEAR rolls down Truska's cheek. That's the last thing Crepsley needed to see. He's defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People in their seats or taking them. Darren is back in his role as usher. He seats two people, wipes at the sweat beading on his forehead. He's getting sicker. He sees Debbie. She and Sam are already seated across the way. She smiles, waves. Darren forces a smile,, waves back. Looking for more patrons, Darren nearly walks into... A FIGURE. A hat pulled down obscures his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An usher in the house of usher. And I can't seem to find a seat. Darren frowns at the odd voice, but leads down the aisle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way. Darren brings him down to a handful of seats. The figure looks up from under the brim of his hat. It's Mr. Tiny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Join me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. As Darren moves to go, Mr. Tiny clamps a hand around his wrist. Like iron. He sits, pulling Darren down beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY It's time we had a few moments. Folks involved in epic struggles should get to know each other. Darren doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Has Crepsley told you about me? Explained me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said you can't be explained. You need to be experienced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY He gives me too much credit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Darren. Darren looks up to see Debbie and Sam. Oh no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna sit on this side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuz we miss you so much. She digs Sam with her elbow. They sit just a row in front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY (WHISPERS) Choosing sides can only lead to trouble. Never, ever choose sides unless it's your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've chosen the vampaneze. Mr. Tiny laughs, slaps his knee even.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Is that really what you think? A smart boy like you? And the lights drop. A trumpet blasts and all is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The little people wheel out a CAGE. There's a gurgled GROWL. The little people retreat. Several audience members lean in, then SCREAM as the wolfman CRASHES to the front of the cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A white spot shines down on Mr. Tall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Ladies and Gentlemen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & MR. TINY MR. TINY .subjugators and saps...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Welcome to the Cirque du Freak. We are an ancient circus... As Mr. Tall drones on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Oh, his speeches are impossible. Mr. Tiny opens his free hand. His pocket watch melts up into view from his palm. Time begins to speed up around them. Mr. Tall's voice speeds to a BUZZ as he 'keystone cops' off the stage and Rhamus 'keystones' on. The audience's small movements become rattles and shakes. Only Darren and Mr. Tiny are at normal speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY I'm not so complicated, Darren. During war there are those who profit. A war between vampires and vampaneze would have terrible consequences. Therefore...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrible profits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Excellent. I am a profiteer. I exact fees and gains. I'm simple. On stage, Madam Truska exits and Evra 'keystones' through his performance with his snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Did Crepsley tell you of the prophesy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What prophesy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY They say the final battle between vampires and vampaneze will be decided by a child. That's why the vampires won't blood children. To avoid the end of the world. As these words are pondered by Darren...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY I think I underestimated you. I think you could be wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you're a creep. I think you suck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Too bad. Mr. Tiny closes his hand around the watch. Time returns to normal. The applause for Evra slowing down to normal speed. As he walks off the stage, Debbie looks back at Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was great! As she looks back to the stage someone sits on Darren's other side. Collar pulled up, head wrapped in a scarf. Murlough!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low; re: Debbie) Is it Dar-wren's girlfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about her -- Murlough takes hold of Darren's other wrist. Still low:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has plenty of lovely blood inside. Inside, outside, hmmm? Darren struggles. Murlough pulls him close, HISSES in his ear, flashing those filthy teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care about humans. I don't care about you. But the vampire - Larten Crepsley - him I care about. (ALMOST SHY) Murlough is a vampire killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . On stage: the spotlight hits Crepsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys are in trouble. There's more than one vampire now. Gavner Purl is here. Murlough reacts to the name. Does not like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen Purl Gavner's face? Young Murlough sliced it for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Darren, you're a liar. He's a thousand miles gone by now. And master Crepsley is right there. As he points at Crepsley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holding Madam Octa's cage. Aware something's 'in the air'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shimmers, phases into flit mode. Disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley! Look out! The audience LAUGHS. Like Darren's worried about Madam Octa. Debbie looks back, knows something is wrong. Sees Mr. Tiny's hand around Darren's wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Murlough 'appears' alongside Crepsley. Madam Octa's cage drops to the stage as Murlough knocks Crepsley fifteen feet through the air. He lands flat on his back. The audience CHEER! Think it's part of the show. Murlough reaches into his jacket, produces a razor-sharp LONG KNIFE in either hand. Crepsley pops to his feet. As his own single BLADE 'switches' to life in his hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & MR. TINY As Darren struggles, Mr. Tiny switches his grip to the back of the boy's neck. That holds him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Murlough charges forward, the long knives pinwheeling in his hands. His attack is brutal and blunt. Crepsley is driven back, parrying each thrust and attack as it comes. Sparks fly as the blades connect. From out of nowhere, Crepsley adds a BACKHAND to the mix. It catches Murlough hard across the chops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Tall and Evra watch. Not knowing what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough swings back wildly. Crepsley catches the blade in Murlough's left hand with the one in his right. Crepsley catches Murlough's left wrist, the second blade dangerously close to retracing the scar on Crepsley's face. Crepsley throws himself back, sending Murlough head over heels across the stage and SLAMMING into a concrete wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Concentrating. Trying to flit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough rolls to his feet, charges. It's brute force versus style. But as Crepsley moves to sidestep, Murlough's not so brutish after all. He matches the move -- Buries one of his knives into Crepsley's stomach. Crepsley reacts, frozen in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & MR. TINY The audience around them unsure. Many shocked. It's part of the show, right? Darren sees Murlough raise the other knife to finish Crepsley off. Darren trembling, phasing. And Mr. Tiny's holding nothing but air. Darren is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speeding down to the stage. The dagger descends in slo- motion, but it's only a centimeter or two from it's target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren reappears, leaps onto Murlough's back, knocks him off target. As Murlough staggers right, Crepsley staggers left. Murlough regroups, charges after him. Badly hurt, stumbling, Crepsley falls off the edge of the stage. Disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough grabs Darren. They disappear as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TINY Sighs. This is not how it's supposed to go. Sam and Debbie leave their seats, head for the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough with Darren in tow, looking high and low for Crepsley. Moving past the barely moving Mr. Tall and Evra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His back to a wall. Trying to hold it together. Frozen
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: facing the exit beyond. As he'loses his flit power, the patrons suddenly resume real speed for the exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old power plant. Pipes and catwalks. Murlough and Darren here. A chain hangs from the ceiling. Murlough lifts Darren, wraps it around his ankle. Hangs Darren upside down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reacting to Murlough's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FACTORY Murlough twists Darren's arm. Darren SCREAMS out in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reacting as Debbie and Sam arrive. They move toward it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listening as the scream fades off. Clutching his stomach, Crepsley moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FACTORY Murlough pulls Darren a little higher. They're face-to-face, though Darren is upsidedown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley will come for his assistant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't care about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough has an assistant, too. A smart one, smarter than you. As Murlough says this, Darren looks past as stepping up, grinning, is Murlough's assistant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve? Steve! Steve holds up his hands so Darren can see the WHITE SCAR on the tip of each finger. He gets closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Tiny made my dream come true. Only better. I'm half vampaneze instead of a stupid half vampire. Mr. Tiny says I have a destiny. He says he's gonna make sure of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that who you talked to? Was that the internet guy? Mr. Tiny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty funny, huh? He introduced himself after you left town. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, I think I've known him a long time in my head. In my bad, bad blood. Chilling. Maybe Steve is evil. He leans in even closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gave me back the dream you stole. Murlough motions Steve quiet, slaps a hand over Darren's mouth. Listens. Smiles. Whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley comes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley moving forward. Hurting. He slows, stops. As he looks back over his shoulder. Something's behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & SAM Freeze as Crepsley looks back in the direction from which they follow. From their POV, Crepsley suddenly disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd he go? They jump as Crepsley appears right in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evra... Get them out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evra knows it's useless. As he nods, Crepsley turns and strides back toward where he had been. Sam and Debbie exchange a look. What the Hell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys better go back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you gonna do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren's my friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ours too. Sam's not so sure, but he nods in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darren swings back and forth in long strokes like a pendulum, a rag stuffed in his mouth to silence him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweeping the room. Wait! It fixes on a doorway. There's Crepsley. Looking about, everywhere but at Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley speaks to 'the room'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can smell it. Why does it hide? (STEPPING UP) The vampire is here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Murlough drops from above. Lands ten feet in front of Crepsley. As they begin to arc around each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vampire will die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get readyyyyy to rumble! Crepsley looks up, reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even the creatures of the night watch too much TV. Darren swings past through the middle of it all. Murlough charges. Crepsley sidesteps Darren, decides to take the fight higher. He leaps up, swings himself up onto one of the catwalks. Murlough follows. They use the room steel as monkey bars as they climb, clash. Violent, quick attacks. Crepsley gaining a position, abandoning it as Murlough SLAMS in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has lost sight of them, he can only hear the battle now. He reacts as Evra, Debbie and Sam rush out. Evra takes hold, lifts, tries to lessen the load on the chain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam, unhook his legs. As Sam struggles, Debbie pulls the rag from Darren's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you guys nuts? Get outta here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's against our code. Suddenly unhooked, Darren hits the ground. He looks up at Evra who grins down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never leave a freak behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the catwalks Murlough draws his knives. Crepsley jumps to the space he wants to defend, draws his own. Murlough counters. Two very serious predators'-at work. The animal kingdom at its killing best. A charge. Murlough a bull, Crepsley a matador. He redirects one of Murlough's arcing arms, smashing it against a metal housing. One of the vampaneze's knives clatters away. It's not graphic or bloody, but several times Crepsley's knife finds its way into Murlough's body. It enrages him, but Crepsley continues dealing out punishment. He's now like a brilliant counter-puncher, even as he inadvertently backs his way into a corner. But as quarters close in, Murlough's rage works to his advantage. He charges into Crepsley, his lowered shoulder sending Crepsley through the air and into... And through a BRICK WALL. Into the thin air outside! Still raging, Murlough nearly falls through himself. Instead, he slips, drops about twenty feet down inside the building!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crepsley falls sixty feet, lands flat on his back, as brick and concrete rain on top of him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Evra pulls Darren along. Debbie and Sam riding shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evra. I think I'm dying. He looks horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's carry him if we have to. Evra and Sam support him on either side. They continue, start across part of a darkened backstage area. A dark rectangular shape looms ahead. We hear a GUTTURAL GROWL, sees eyes glow in the gloom. They freeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. It's the wolfman. He's in his cage. They move forward again, the cage becomes visible. But another SHAPE beside it. Steve. He sets his hand on the cage's heavy latch. He's going to open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No don't!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooops... Steve lifts the latch. Even he doesn't expect the force the wolfman hits the door with. Whaanngg! It's out. Evra steps bravely forward. The wolfman sends him flying. Sam can't hold Darren up by himself. He doesn't even see the Wolfman leap over. As Darren sinks to the floor... The wolfman tears into Sam...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reacts in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's more surprised than shocked. Until the wolfman looks his way. Then he heads for the hills, disappears into the dark. The wolfman turns back toward Debbie. She backs away, takes off up a rickety stairway. The wolfman
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then follows. Darren's too weak to follow, near tears in frustration and regret. He watches after them, then he looks over at Sam. Sam who is dying. Just a few feet away. His eyes flicker to Darren's. He tries to say something, but can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Sam. Oh no... Darren crawls over, takes Sam's bloody hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go save Debbie, Darren... Sam manages the smallest smile. As his eyes drift shut...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think she loves you... From above, we hear Debbie SCREAM. Darren considers Sam's blood, knows what he has to do. Leave his humanity behind and cross the line. He needs to drink Sam's blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, Sam, but I need strength. I need blood. As Darren extends his nails over Sam's wrist...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to save her together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debbie backing into a corner. The wolfman almost on her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Murlough arrives! Pure animal action as he tears into wolfie, sends him retreating, licking his wounds into the darkness. Murlough heaves for breath, pretty beat up himself. And here comes Steve. Cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Crepsley dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows? Young Murlough lives, but he's hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can Dar-wren's girlfriend do? We need to get the blood inside outside. Don't we? Then we hear it: a blood-curdling scream filters up. It's:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! - BACKSTAGE AREA He's drunk Sam's blood. He rises. His sickness wicking off him. Strength descending. Empowered. Furious. He screams again, the sound taking shape into words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The audience who haven't left react as the chilling sound reaches them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FACTORY Fully 1/2 vampire powered, he takes the stairs two at a time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murlough, looming over Debbie, smiles as Darren arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop being a big shot. This isn't like stopping some fight at school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Murlough's eyes go very, very dark. He attacks. Darren tries to meet the onslaught, but he's bowled over. Knocked in a heap. Debbie moves to go after Murlough from behind. She's going to go down fighting as well. But Steve intercepts her. He's pretty powerful himself. Murlough pulls Darren to his feet, stands him up. He swings his fist in a vicious arc. Darren just ducks it and Murlough's fist SMASHES right through the wall (an inside wall) alongside Darren's head. Murlough's getting tired of Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need to stand still so you can die. But as he attempts to pull his arm back through, he can't. He frowns. Then his eyes widen in pain. Murlough jerks his arm back as hard as he can. The wall smashes open as Murlough brings his arm back through with Crepsley hanging onto the end of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The audience who remain chanting: "Refund! Refund!" They react as debris falls from above, smashes to the stage.
direction.name: direction
