direction.raw_text: - FACTORY Crepsley brings up his knife. Murlough catches him by the wrist with one hand. With the other he grips Crepsley by the throat, SLAMS him hard into an I-beam pillar. Again. Then he squeezes. We can hear the cartilage crunching in Crepsley's throat. But Crepsley covers his own right hand with his left. He drives the knife blade INTO MURLOUGH'S HEART! Murlough looks down at the handle of the knife, then back at Crepsley whose throat he still holds. Murlough gives him a lopsided grin and then pitches back, falling through one of the holes in the floor. Taking Crepsley with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the audience as Murlough descends. Somewhere in mid-fall, Crepsley FLITS, disappears. When Murlough hits the center of the stage, he hits it alone. Dead. As people start for the exits, we see Mr. Tiny'is among them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But as Darren stands, it's not over. Steve grabs Debbie, pushes her to the edge where the rafters are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay back! Or I'll throw her off! I mean it! It sounds like he does. Darren looks intently at Debbie. She looks back. Then, Darren makes CHICKEN CLUCK SOUNDS. Understanding, Debbie tears herself away. To the precipice. But instead of falling, she continues out on a rafter. Steve slides out after her. But as he reaches for her, she deftly skips across the rafters, jumps back to the floor. Before Steve can follow, Darren cuts him off. Below them: rows of jagged, rusty pipes. The remains of a pumping station. Shredded now, broken. Waiting to impale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over, Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it? Steve lunges. They come together, trading shots, stumbling but still having to make the rafters. A missed footfall will be their last. They separate, try to gain position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna hear something funny? After your funeral, I went to see your parents. They continue circling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they were fine. They acted like they barely remembered you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar. Darren lunges, but Steve's ready. He CUFFS Darren in the head. Darren falls, ends up hanging. Steve looms, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And your sister. She was moving into your room. They had a yard sale. I bought some of your stuff. Steve's foot on his hand. Darren about to die. Oddly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you steal money from my mom's purse?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you? Darren hanging there, dead grim. Steve's curious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you ask? Is knowing that gonna help you rest in peace?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's just practically the last thing that ever happened between me and my dad was I was arguing with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Least you had a dad to argue with. A fury building in Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was telling him he was wrong about you. That's the last time we had together. Fighting about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hate to tell ya. Your dad was right. How do you think we got the money for the dumb tickets? I took it. Just like I'm gonna take you. Steve jams his foot down into Darren's face, but Darren hangs on. In fact, with a superhuman surge, he hauls himself up, no matter how many times Steve hits him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Darren lets Steve have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss him so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Steve's arm pinwheel for balance. He's going over. But just as he pitches off the end rafter... Darren catches him by his belt. Nearly bent backward, he hangs back over the abyss. If Darren lets go, Steve will fall into the spikes below. Crespley steps up beside Debbie, knows what Darren should do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill him, Darren. Do it now so you won't have to do it later. Darren looks at Steve. A moment they'll remember forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He used to be my friend. Darren flings Steve back the other way. To safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start running. Don't ever stop. Steve hesitates. It wasn't supposed to be like this. Darren starts off the rafter toward him. One last look of hate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next time... And he's gone. Disappearing into the dark. Darren joins Debbie. Nothing left to hide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sam? Darren shakes his head. Sam didn't make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She understands. Darren looks at Crepsley. He's a mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you gonna be okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need to catch my breath. For a few days. Maybe a week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I made a mistake, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I think that you proved yourself human after all. Human. As Darren absorbs this kindness, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half human. What now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a war on, isn't there? Crepsley shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This world is crossed by fences. You have to decide which side you stand on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes. Black and white fences crossing very gray fields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not gray. I've met the bad guys. They need to be stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure it's my fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you said it. There's no in between. And the power of being alone is never going to be greater than the weakness. It's our fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As PATRONS try to get as far as they can as quick as they can. We see Steve duck out, blending in. Mr. Tiny's Lincoln Continental pulls up. As Steve gets in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Tall, Evra, Debbie, Darren and Crepsley. Crepsley sets Sam's body down in the grass. It's covered with one of Madam Truska's tent silks. As Crepsley's eyes meet Darren's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was a good kid. It's weird, but I remember things about him even though I wasn't there when they happened. Even though it's impossible. A moment as Crepsley nods sadly at this most singular boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His blood is in you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL I'll deal with the police when they come. What I'll say, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say what happened. Some crazy guy showed up. Sam was in the wrong place at the wrong time. They're all quiet a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was brave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the only time in his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't die in vain. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Time to fly or flit or whatever you call it. The sun won't wait all night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, that's exactly what it does. Mr. Tall manages a smile, considers the sky a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Time will tell what this night has brought us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Keep my coffin ready, would you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TALL Always. As they exchange farewells, Debbie turns to Darren.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think we'll meet again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never know. As she hugs him tight, she whispers in his ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope is a good word. I hope so, too. And so goodbye. Darren and Crepsley start down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To meet the Vampire Generals. War clouds are forming. A storm is coming. And I have a feeling you're needed much more than I am.
direction.name: direction
